alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ulster County through 815 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Willowemoc, or 15 miles north of Liberty, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... West Shokan, Woodland Valley Campground, Mount Tremper, Phoenicia, Denning, Turnwood, Frost Valley, Peekamoose, Beechford, Winchell, Oliverea, Brodhead, Woodland, Ladleton, Branch, Belle Ayr, Seager, Hardenburg and Bull Run. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
